intro: Anchusa arvensis subsp. occidentalis, commonly known as western blueweed, is a perennial herb native to western North America. It is characterized by its blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer, typically from June to August. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and grows in open areas such as fields and roadsides. It is part of the Boraginaceae family, known for its medicinal and ornamental uses. Anchusa arvensis subsp. occidentalis is often used in native plant gardens due to its hardiness and attractive appearance.
